items.text: I honestly believe I am a more exceptional person than almost everyone I meet.
items.rationale: Directly reflects an inflated, admirable view of the self relative to others, core to narcissistic self-image.

items.text: People are naturally drawn to me because of my unique qualities and charm.
items.rationale: Conveys a grandiose belief in one's own attractiveness and specialness as perceived by others.

items.text: I deserve recognition and praise for the things I accomplish, even when others don't seem to notice.
items.rationale: Reflects entitlement to admiration and a sense that one's achievements are underappreciated.

items.text: When I walk into a room, I feel confident that I'm one of the most impressive people there.
items.rationale: Captures the grandiose self-appraisal and social confidence characteristic of narcissistic self-image.

items.text: I have a special talent that sets me apart from ordinary people.
items.rationale: Belief in unique, superior abilities is a hallmark of the admirable self-image in narcissism.

items.text: Others have told me I come across as someone who thinks very highly of themselves.
items.rationale: Third-person observation reflecting the outward expression of an inflated self-concept.

items.text: I often feel that I am destined for greatness in ways that most people are not.
items.rationale: Grandiose sense of destiny and specialness directly maps to admirable self-image.

items.text: I take great pride in my appearance and believe I present myself better than most people do.
items.rationale: Narcissistic investment in physical self-presentation as a source of superiority.

items.text: I know I have qualities that make me superior to the average person.
items.rationale: Direct endorsement of superiority beliefs central to narcissistic self-image.

items.text: My accomplishments speak for themselves — I don't need to prove my worth to anyone.
items.rationale: Reflects a secure but grandiose sense of self-worth rooted in perceived achievements.

items.text: I sometimes catch myself imagining the admiration I'll receive when people learn about my successes.
items.rationale: Fantasy of admiration is a core narcissistic process tied to self-image maintenance.

items.text: I feel that my life story is more interesting and meaningful than most people's.
items.rationale: Grandiose narrative identity reflecting inflated self-importance.

items.text: I sometimes feel underappreciated, but I remind myself that not everyone can recognize true talent.
items.rationale: Mixes vulnerability with grandiosity; the self-reassurance maps to admirable self-image but the hurt could suggest fragility.

items.text: I tend to compare myself favorably to people who are considered successful in my field.
items.rationale: Social comparison in a self-enhancing direction maps to admirable self-image, though comparison processes can also relate to competitiveness.

items.text: I find it easy to envision myself in positions of power and influence because I naturally think on a larger scale than others.
items.rationale: The self-aggrandizing vision maps to admirable self-image, but 'thinking on a larger scale' overlaps with cognitively expansive thinking.

items.text: My mind naturally gravitates toward big-picture ideas rather than getting bogged down in small details.
items.rationale: Preference for broad, expansive thinking over detail-oriented processing is central to cognitive expansiveness in narcissism.

items.text: I often have grand plans and visions that others find difficult to keep up with.
items.rationale: Grandiose ideation and the belief that one's thinking surpasses others' capacity directly reflects cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I can see connections and possibilities that most people completely miss.
items.rationale: Belief in superior perceptual and cognitive abilities reflects the inflated cognitive self-appraisal of this factor.

items.text: When I share my ideas, people are often amazed by how far ahead I'm thinking.
items.rationale: Perceived intellectual superiority and visionary thinking are hallmarks of narcissistic cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I tend to think in terms of sweeping strategies rather than incremental steps.
items.rationale: Preference for grand strategy over mundane planning reflects the expansive cognitive style.

items.text: I believe I understand complex situations more quickly and deeply than most people around me.
items.rationale: Inflated belief in one's own intellectual processing speed and depth is core to this factor.

items.text: People have described me as someone who always has a bold, ambitious vision for the future.
items.rationale: Third-person observation of grandiose future-oriented thinking maps clearly to cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I get bored easily with routine tasks because my mind is always racing toward the next big idea.
items.rationale: Restlessness driven by grandiose ideation and disdain for the mundane reflects expansive cognition.

items.text: I often feel that conventional rules and procedures are too limiting for someone with my level of insight.
items.rationale: Belief that standard frameworks cannot contain one's superior thinking is a narcissistic cognitive pattern.

items.text: I frequently come up with innovative solutions that others wouldn't have thought of on their own.
items.rationale: Grandiose belief in one's unique creative and problem-solving abilities maps to cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: My thinking operates on a different level than most of the people I interact with daily.
items.rationale: Direct assertion of cognitive superiority is a clear marker of narcissistic expansive cognition.

items.text: I have a knack for seeing the broader implications of events that others treat as trivial.
items.rationale: Belief in superior pattern recognition and meaning-making reflects expansive cognitive style.

items.text: Sometimes I get so caught up in my grand plans that I overlook practical considerations.
items.rationale: Acknowledges a downside of expansive thinking, which adds some self-awareness that slightly reduces confidence in pure factor mapping.

items.text: I enjoy intellectually dominating conversations because I usually have the most informed perspective.
items.rationale: Intellectual dominance maps to cognitive expansiveness but the interpersonal control element introduces some overlap with exploitive interpersonal style.

items.text: I naturally take charge in group settings because I can see the best path forward more clearly than anyone else.
items.rationale: The cognitive superiority belief maps to expansiveness, but taking charge and directing others overlaps with interpersonal exploitation and dominance.

items.text: I have no problem using someone's weaknesses to get what I need from them.
items.rationale: Direct endorsement of exploiting others' vulnerabilities for personal gain is the core of interpersonal exploitation.

items.text: People exist in my life primarily in terms of what they can do for me.
items.rationale: Instrumental view of relationships is a defining feature of narcissistic interpersonal exploitation.

items.text: I am skilled at getting people to do things for me without them realizing they're being directed.
items.rationale: Covert manipulation and social influence for personal benefit directly maps to exploitive interpersonal style.

items.text: If someone isn't useful to me anymore, I have little reason to maintain the relationship.
items.rationale: Discarding relationships based on utility reflects the transactional, exploitive nature of narcissistic relating.

items.text: I often charm people initially to establish a connection that I can leverage later.
items.rationale: Strategic use of charm as a tool for future exploitation is a hallmark of this factor.

items.text: I see social situations as opportunities to advance my own interests.
items.rationale: Viewing social interactions instrumentally for self-advancement is core to interpersonal exploitation.

items.text: Others have accused me of being manipulative, but I see it as being strategic.
items.rationale: Reframing manipulation as strategy reflects the ego-syntonic nature of exploitive behavior in narcissism.

items.text: I know exactly what to say to get people on my side, and I use that ability freely.
items.rationale: Deliberate use of social influence skills for personal gain maps directly to exploitation.

items.text: I tend to surround myself with people who are willing to support my goals and ambitions.
items.rationale: Curating a social environment based on others' utility to oneself reflects exploitive relating.

items.text: I don't feel guilty about taking advantage of a situation, even if it comes at someone else's expense.
items.rationale: Lack of guilt over interpersonal exploitation is a key affective component of this factor.

items.text: I've been told that I treat people like stepping stones on my way to the top.
items.rationale: Third-person observation of using others instrumentally for advancement clearly maps to exploitation.

items.text: When negotiating, I focus on maximizing my advantage regardless of whether the other person feels the deal is fair.
items.rationale: Zero-sum interpersonal orientation with disregard for others' outcomes reflects exploitive style.

items.text: I find it easy to read people and figure out what motivates them, which helps me get what I want.
items.rationale: Social perceptiveness used instrumentally maps to exploitation, but the skill itself could reflect general social intelligence without exploitive intent.

items.text: I prefer to be in control of my relationships because I know what's best for everyone involved.
items.rationale: Interpersonal control maps to exploitation, but the rationalization of knowing what's best introduces a paternalistic element that could also reflect admirable self-image.

items.text: I expect the people around me to recognize my superiority and defer to my judgment in important matters.
items.rationale: Expecting deference involves interpersonal dominance (exploitive), but the belief in one's own superiority and entitlement to recognition overlaps substantially with admirable self-image.
